reason: C&D winner in top form; model win chance 35% vs market 14%; tactically suited and thriving off revised mark.
Market overrating on past figures; poor suitability for trip and recent heavy-ground defeat suggest major risks.
Course form, ground preference, and reliable recent efforts combine for standout value. Strong 5f profile on firm.
22-race losing streak and poor recent form; major model underperformance risk vs short price.

Looks primed for this 2m4f trip on good ground at a sharp track; shaped better than bare result last time over shorter when staying on steadily. Back on last winning mark and gets pace to run at in a weaker race. Profile suggests today is the target â€” a major player at a big price.

Bounced back to form last time with a staying-on third at Market Rasen and now drops back slightly in trip with cheekpieces retained. Has a solid hurdling foundation, ideal ground conditions, and trainer has a smart record with second-time cheekpieces. More to come off this mark.

Shaped like a winner-in-waiting when staying on late at Haydock last time; drops to a sharper Catterick 6f with strong pace forecast and gets ideal conditions to pounce. Unexposed at the trip, well drawn, and stable in solid nick. Value price for a profile peaking now.
C&D winner who thrives on fast ground; tactically favoured in small field from low draw. Apprentice useful; looks ready to strike again.
Shaped strongly on UK debut in Irish maiden. Now back handicapping off good mark; lightly raced improver.
Big scope off revised mark after easy win at Wolves. Stays well, settled better last time, now suited by trip/ground.
Super consistent, proven at trip and track. Eased in grade and retains claimer who gets a good tune out of him. Very solid profile.
4-time C&D winner eased 2lb; back at favoured track. Solid place chance and wins in this grade before.
